content.question: To perform an experiment, students construct a pendulum by hanging a large solid metal sphere from a light string that is attached to the ceiling. A student pulls the sphere back to a small angle and releases the sphere from rest. Students measure the time it takes the sphere to swing back and forth ten times and then divide this time by ten to determine the period <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the pendulum. This experiment is conducted for several different lengths <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the string. Which of the following graphs best represents the data for the experiment?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph in the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled L and the vertical axis is labeled T squared. There are no numbers indicated. The line begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right with a decreasing rate. Near the height of the vertical axis the line becomes almost horizontal.

The figure presents a graph in the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled L and the vertical axis is labeled T squared. There are no numbers indicated. The line begins at the origin and moves horizontally along the horizontal axis briefly. About halfway along the horizontal axis and a quarter of the way up the vertical axis, the line curves steeply upward and to the right.

The figure presents a graph in the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled L and the vertical axis is labeled T squared. There are no numbers indicated. The straight line begins at the origin and extends upward and to the right at a constant rate bisecting the plane.

The figure presents a graph in the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled L squared and the vertical axis is labeled T. There are no numbers indicated. The straight line begins at the origin and extends upward at a constant rate bisecting the plane.

The figure presents a graph in the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled L and the vertical axis is labeled T. There are no numbers indicated. The straight line begins at the origin and extends upward and to the right at a constant rate bisecting the plane.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph in the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled L and the vertical axis is labeled T squared. There are no numbers indicated. The straight line begins at the origin and extends upward and to the right at a constant rate bisecting the plane.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
